fields.Title of Contribution: Students’ proofs of one-to-one and onto properties in introductory Abstract Algebra
fields.Journal: International Journal of Mathematical Education in Science and Technology
fields.Description/Abstract: Many successful undergraduate mathematics students struggle learning to write proofs. Even students who may enjoy problem solving and prefer conceptual understanding can find the nonprocedural nature of proof-writing to be technically difficult and ambiguous. This qualitative study examines 23 undergraduate students’ comprehension of one-to-one and onto proofs in a first course in abstract algebra. Data collected consisted of homework, in-class quizzes, and in-class tests. Through coding of student work, the researchers found students’ misconceptions and errors depended on the specific abstract algebra topic and their mathematics background. Implications for teaching and research are also discussed.
